description: Single storey side/rear extension; and external alterations
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990.

| The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings: TQRQM22056210621705 (Site Map); A1 (Existing Block Plans); A1 b (Proposed Block Plan); A2 (Existing Elevations); A5 (Single Storey Rear/Infill Extension Proposed Drawings); A6 (Single Storey Rear/Infill Extension Proposed Elevations & Elevations).
REASON: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| The materials to be used for the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing, unless otherwise stated on either the submitted application form or the drawings / plans as listed in Condition (2).

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with Policies D3 and D4 of the London Plan (2021), Policies 7.4, 7.6 and 7B of Adopted Ealing Development Management Plan Document (2013), Policies 1.1 (k) and 1.2 (f) of the adopted Development (Core) Strategy (2012). | Notwithstanding the provisions of Article 3 of the Town and Country Planning (General Permitted Development) (England) Order 2016 (as amended) (or any subsequent amendment or new Order), no windows or other openings (other than those shown on the submitted plans) shall be formed in the walls or roof of the buildings.

Reason: To protect residential amenity in accordance with policies 1.1, 1.2 & 3.8 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4 & 7B of the Ealing Development Management Development Plan Document (2013). | No part of the roof of the extensions shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.
Reason:  To protect the living conditions of occupants of nearby properties in accordance with policies 7.4, and 7.B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013).
